Samples: Playing WAV File to Sound Device

This is a very simple example to use the WAV File Player and Sound Device Port. In this example, we open both the file and sound device, and connect the two of them, and voila! Sound will be playing the contents of the file.

See also:
page_pjmedia_samples_recfile_c

This file is pjsip-apps/src/samples/playfile.c

00001 /* $Id: playfile.c 3553 2011-05-05 06:14:19Z nanang $ */
00002 /* 
00003  * Copyright (C) 2008-2011 Teluu Inc. (http://www.teluu.com)
00004  * Copyright (C) 2003-2008 Benny Prijono <benny@prijono.org>
00005  *
00006  * This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
00007  * it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
00008  * the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or
00009  * (at your option) any later version.
00010  *
00011  * This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
00012  * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
00013  * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
00014  * GNU General Public License for more details.
00015  *
00016  * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
00017  * along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software
00018  * Foundation, Inc., 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA 
00019  */
00020 
00021 #include <pjmedia.h>
00022 #include <pjlib-util.h>
00023 #include <pjlib.h>
00024 #include <stdio.h>
00025 #include <stdlib.h>
00026 
00027 #include "util.h"
00028 
00029 
00046 /*
00047  * playfile.c
00048  *
00049  * PURPOSE:
00050  *  Play a WAV file to sound player device.
00051  *
00052  * USAGE:
00053  *  playfile FILE.WAV
00054  *
00055  *  The WAV file could have mono or stereo channels with arbitrary
00056  *  sampling rate, but MUST contain uncompressed (i.e. 16bit) PCM.
00057  *
00058  */
00059 
00060 
00061 /* For logging purpose. */
00062 #define THIS_FILE   "playfile.c"
00063 
00064 
00065 static const char *desc = 
00066 " FILE                                                              \n"
00067 "                                                                   \n"
00068 "  playfile.c                                                       \n"
00069 "                                                                   \n"
00070 " PURPOSE                                                           \n"
00071 "                                                                   \n"
00072 "  Demonstrate how to play a WAV file.                              \n"
00073 "                                                                   \n"
00074 " USAGE                                                             \n"
00075 "                                                                   \n"
00076 "  playfile FILE.WAV                                                \n"
00077 "                                                                   \n"
00078 "  The WAV file could have mono or stereo channels with arbitrary   \n"
00079 "  sampling rate, but MUST contain uncompressed (i.e. 16bit) PCM.   \n";
00080 
00081 
00082 /*
00083  * main()
00084  */
00085 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00086 {
00087     pj_caching_pool cp;
00088     pjmedia_endpt *med_endpt;
00089     pj_pool_t *pool;
00090     pjmedia_port *file_port;
00091     pjmedia_snd_port *snd_port;
00092     char tmp[10];
00093     pj_status_t status;
00094 
00095 
00096     if (argc != 2) {
00097         puts("Error: filename required");
00098         puts(desc);
00099         return 1;
00100     }
00101 
00102 
00103     /* Must init PJLIB first: */
00104     status = pj_init();
00105     PJ_ASSERT_RETURN(status == PJ_SUCCESS, 1);
00106 
00107     /* Must create a pool factory before we can allocate any memory. */
00108     pj_caching_pool_init(&cp, &pj_pool_factory_default_policy, 0);
00109 
00110     /* 
00111      * Initialize media endpoint.
00112      * This will implicitly initialize PJMEDIA too.
00113      */
00114     status = pjmedia_endpt_create(&cp.factory, NULL, 1, &med_endpt);
00115     PJ_ASSERT_RETURN(status == PJ_SUCCESS, 1);
00116 
00117     /* Create memory pool for our file player */
00118     pool = pj_pool_create( &cp.factory,     /* pool factory         */
00119                            "wav",           /* pool name.           */
00120                            4000,            /* init size            */
00121                            4000,            /* increment size       */
00122                            NULL             /* callback on error    */
00123                            );
00124 
00125     /* Create file media port from the WAV file */
00126     status = pjmedia_wav_player_port_create(  pool,     /* memory pool      */
00127                                               argv[1],  /* file to play     */
00128                                               20,       /* ptime.           */
00129                                               0,        /* flags            */
00130                                               0,        /* default buffer   */
00131                                               &file_port/* returned port    */
00132                                               );
00133     if (status != PJ_SUCCESS) {
00134         app_perror(THIS_FILE, "Unable to use WAV file", status);
00135         return 1;
00136     }
00137 
00138     /* Create sound player port. */
00139     status = pjmedia_snd_port_create_player( 
00140                  pool,                              /* pool                 */
00141                  -1,                                /* use default dev.     */
00142                  file_port->info.clock_rate,        /* clock rate.          */
00143                  file_port->info.channel_count,     /* # of channels.       */
00144                  file_port->info.samples_per_frame, /* samples per frame.   */
00145                  file_port->info.bits_per_sample,   /* bits per sample.     */
00146                  0,                                 /* options              */
00147                  &snd_port                          /* returned port        */
00148                  );
00149     if (status != PJ_SUCCESS) {
00150         app_perror(THIS_FILE, "Unable to open sound device", status);
00151         return 1;
00152     }
00153 
00154     /* Connect file port to the sound player.
00155      * Stream playing will commence immediately.
00156      */
00157     status = pjmedia_snd_port_connect( snd_port, file_port);
00158     PJ_ASSERT_RETURN(status == PJ_SUCCESS, 1);
00159 
00160 
00161 
00162     /* 
00163      * File should be playing and looping now, using sound device's thread. 
00164      */
00165 
00166 
00167     /* Sleep to allow log messages to flush */
00168     pj_thread_sleep(100);
00169 
00170 
00171     printf("Playing %s..\n", argv[1]);
00172     puts("");
00173     puts("Press <ENTER> to stop playing and quit");
00174 
00175     if (fgets(tmp, sizeof(tmp), stdin) == NULL) {
00176         puts("EOF while reading stdin, will quit now..");
00177     }
00178 
00179     
00180     /* Start deinitialization: */
00181 
00182     /* Disconnect sound port from file port */
00183     status = pjmedia_snd_port_disconnect(snd_port);
00184     PJ_ASSERT_RETURN(status == PJ_SUCCESS, 1);
00185 
00186     /* Without this sleep, Windows/DirectSound will repeteadly
00187      * play the last frame during destroy.
00188      */
00189     pj_thread_sleep(100);
00190 
00191     /* Destroy sound device */
00192     status = pjmedia_snd_port_destroy( snd_port );
00193     PJ_ASSERT_RETURN(status == PJ_SUCCESS, 1);
00194 
00195 
00196     /* Destroy file port */
00197     status = pjmedia_port_destroy( file_port );
00198     PJ_ASSERT_RETURN(status == PJ_SUCCESS, 1);
00199 
00200 
00201     /* Release application pool */
00202     pj_pool_release( pool );
00203 
00204     /* Destroy media endpoint. */
00205     pjmedia_endpt_destroy( med_endpt );
00206 
00207     /* Destroy pool factory */
00208     pj_caching_pool_destroy( &cp );
00209 
00210     /* Shutdown PJLIB */
00211     pj_shutdown();
00212 
00213 
00214     /* Done. */
00215     return 0;
00216 }
00217
